title: Trump Declares Victory Over ISIS in Syria – Is He Correct?
subtitle: US President Donald Trump has prematurely declared win over the Islamic State group in Syria.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
TRUMP: “We have defeated ISIS in Syria, my only reason for being there during the Trump Presidency.” - tweet on 19 December.

THE FACTS: The militants still hold a string of villages and towns along the Euphrates River in eastern Syria, where they have resisted weeks of attacks by the US-supported Syrian Democratic Forces to drive them out.

The pocket is home to about 15,000 people, among them 2,000 ISIS fighters, according to US military estimates. But that figure could be as high as 8,000 militants, if fighters hiding out in the deserts of south of the Euphrates River are also counted, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, which monitors the conflict through networks of local informants.

Observatory head Rami Abdurrahman said that they include seasoned militants who have fought global wars of jihad since the 1990s.

The SDF, a Kurdish-led force that is America’s only military partner in Syria, said on 20 December, “The war against Islamic State has not ended and the group has not been defeated.” The group is at the front lines of the battle against ISIS along the Euphrates river. It said that a US withdrawal would leave Syrians “between the claws of enemy forces.”

At their height in 2014, ISIS militants controlled approximately a third of territory in Syria and Iraq, including major cities in both countries. The group flourished in the political vacuum of Syria’s civil war, in which President Bashar Assad has violently put down a 2011 uprising against his family’s 40-year rule.
